place.name: LITTLE GRIMSBY
place.gazetteerText: GRIMSBY (LITTLE), a parish in Linth district, Lincoln; adjacent to the East Lincoln railway, 3 miles N of Linth. Post town, Linth. Acres, 950. Real property, £1, 235. Pop., 55. house, 10. The property belongs mainly to Lord F. Beauclerk; whose seat is Little Grimsby Hall. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £106. Patron, Lord F. Beauclerk. The church is good; and the churchyard contains monuments to the Nelthorpes. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
